Utterance: Hi! Welcome back. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay, but I had a rough day yesterday.
I’m sorry to hear that. What happened?
I just felt really overwhelmed with work again. It got to me more than usual.
That sounds tough. What do you think triggered those feelings?
I had a deadline approaching, and I felt like I was drowning in tasks.
It’s understandable to feel that way when the pressure builds. How did you cope with those feelings yesterday?
I tried to take a break and go for a walk, but I just ended up feeling more anxious.
Sometimes breaks can be hard to navigate, especially when you’re feeling overwhelmed. What do you think made the walk feel unhelpful?
I think I was just too in my head about everything. I couldn’t clear my mind.
That’s a common experience. When we’re anxious, it can be hard to focus on the present. Have you thought about using your breathing exercises during those moments?
I haven’t, but that might help.
It could be a good way to ground yourself. Would you like to practice a quick breathing exercise together now?
Sure, that sounds good.
Okay, let’s take a deep breath in through your nose... hold it for a moment... and now exhale slowly through your mouth.
*inhales deeply* … *exhales slowly*
Great! Let’s do that a couple more times. Inhale... hold... and exhale.
*repeats*
How does that feel?
It feels a bit calming.
That’s wonderful to hear. You can use that technique whenever you start to feel overwhelmed at work.
I’ll definitely try to remember that.
Good! Now, how did your letter to your mom go?
I wrote it, and it was really cathartic. I felt a mix of sadness and relief.
That’s a beautiful way to honor her memory. Writing can be such a powerful release.
Yeah, I didn’t expect it to feel that way.
It’s great that you were able to express those feelings. Have you thought about making it a regular practice?
I think I might. It helped me process my emotions.
That sounds like a healthy outlet. How have your other coping strategies been working for you?
I’ve been trying to stick to my hiking and journaling. They both help.
That’s excellent! It sounds like you’re building a solid toolkit for managing your emotions.
I think so. I just need to keep reminding myself to use them.
Consistency is key. Have you had any moments lately where you’ve felt a sense of joy or contentment?
I did feel happy when I was hiking last weekend. It was a nice escape.
That’s wonderful! Finding those moments of joy is so important for your well-being.
Yeah, I need to focus on those more.
Absolutely! Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I’d like to talk about my anger. I feel like it’s been bubbling up more lately.
Anger can be a difficult emotion to navigate. What do you think is triggering that anger for you?
I think it’s a combination of work stress and my grief. Sometimes I just snap at people.
It’s understandable to feel that way, especially when you’re carrying so much. How do you usually express that anger?
I tend to just let it out in the moment, which I regret later.
That’s common. Would you be open to exploring some healthier ways to express that anger?
Yeah, I think I need that.
One option could be finding a physical outlet, like exercise or even hitting a pillow. It can help release pent-up energy.
I like that idea. I could use my hiking time to let out some frustration.
That sounds like a great plan! You could also try journaling your feelings when you’re angry to help process them.
I’ll give that a shot.
Wonderful! Remember, anger is a normal emotion, and it’s okay to feel it. It’s how we express it that matters.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your help with this.
You’re welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Let’s keep building on that.
I will. See you next time!
See you soon! Take care!
